ygData.subject: Getting into the raids
ygData.msgSnippet: Luna, I noticed you organize the calendars for the FG, Dragon, and Plane raids.  I have now hit my 40th season and am at the minimum level for the FGs.  I am
ygData.messageBody:
Luna, I noticed you organize the calendars for the FG, Dragon, and Plane
raids. I have now hit my 40th season and am at the minimum level for
the FGs. I am hoping within the next 3 weeks to be up to where I can
start doing more, but would dearly like to begin meeting and getting
involved so that when eligible I can be considered.

What advice would you give for doing such. From the outside it seems
the lists fill up quickly and it is necessary to either be in one of the
big guilds or be an under-represented class to get in (perhaps just fear
on my part). While I have some friends who go, I'd kind of like to get
myself in on my own (stubborn female pride, but I don't want to depend
on my man to take care of me nor do I want him to think I'm only with
him because he can get me into raids).

I found the board where the schedules are posted. Do I just contact the
organizers and let them know I want to go? Best to do that in tells
in-game? Any advice on this would be greatly appreciated.

Also, Mithril Empire has a strong group now of 8 soldiers in the 40th
rank and above who hunt together almost nightly. Since I seem to be
the Guild's social director by default (not complaining, I think it's a
total rush to pull a bunch of people together and organize a dungeon
raid and clearly Druid is the prefect class for me as I can pick people
up to make sure everyone arrives), how would I go about, say, putting
together an ME based FG raid? We would clearly need more players than
we. And while Sylvanar has been, it would be nice to have other
veterans as well to guide us and show us the ropes (broad hint there
;-). And I'd like to include others who are just hitting the ranks as I
suspect my eagerness to try these areas is not unique.

If you want to reply in private, my e-mail address is judy3t@....

My sincerest thanks,
Iceiallana Forestfury
Druid of the 40th circle
Mithril Empire
